result.execSummary:
The defendant Gordon D Larson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If paroled:
No contact with Bethany.
No unsupervised contact with anyone under the age of 18 without prior Agent approval.
Cooperate, attend, participate in all treatment programs recommended by an Agent including Sex Offender treatment.
No possession of pornographic or sexually explicit material.
No possession or use of any computer or technological device with internet capabilities without prior permission from an Agent.
Comply with Sex Offender registration program.
Pay for DNA  costs and testing.
Provide DNA sample if not already done.

Court Costs and DNA to be paid, if paroled.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: from Bill G. filed by Defense

Defendant Gordon D Larson in court with attorney Jack Alan Umpleby.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties proceed to sentencing on Ct. 1. Corrections to PSI addressed. Victim made statements. Restitution to be determined if a restitution hearing is requested. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Total sentence: 18 years prison
- Court Costs totaling $70.00 ($20.00 and $50.00 from 1989) to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision. 
- DNA Surcharge totaling $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
- Conditions of Extended Supervision: No contact with Bethany. No unsupervised contact with anyone under 18 without prior agent approval. Cooperate, attend, participate in all treatment programs recommended by an agent including sex offender treatment. No possession of pornographic or sexually explicit material.  No possession or use of any computer or technological device with internet capabilities without prior permission from an agent. Compliance with sex offender registration program. Compliance with DNA testing & pay for that. DNA Sample if not yet provided.
Letter filed by third party dated 1/26/15.
Sentencing hearing on January 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on January 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Gordon D Larson in court with attorney Jack Alan Umpleby.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1,  Court finds defendant guilty.  Cts. 2 and 3 dismissed and read-in. State and Defense request a Pre-sentence Investigation. Court orders a PSI to be compiled and filed within 45 days. Court will give another date for sentencing. Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 24, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Arraignment on November 17, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant to have no contact with victim/witnesses and not to discuss this case with his family members. No contact with any minors unless supervised by another adult present.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing
Defendant Gordon D Larson in court with attorney Jack A. Umpleby.  Lesli S. Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Arraignment scheduled for November 17, 2014 at 08:15 am.
